intro: Asterocephalus agrestis, commonly known as the rough asterocephalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Asterocephalus agrestis is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in traditional medicine.
